Based on the description, it appears that the issue is related to a possible electrical fault or malfunction within the Bogen E7000 system. The humming noise, even after inputs are removed, suggests that there might be an electrical issue with the amplifier itself.

The fact that the problem is resolved by cycling the power suggests that there might be a temporary electrical fault or a fault in the power supply unit (PSU) of the amplifier. The absence of any ground faults or load issues further supports this theory.

The installation of the same amp at the site, which has worked flawlessly for weeks, suggests that the issue is specific

subject: SIP and paging integration issue
query:
Customer had a new phone system installed at two different campuses. _x000D_
Configured Grandstream ht813s at each location with identical configurations except for the server SIP server address as there are different controllers for each of the campuses. _x000D_
The Station in each controller is configured the same as well minus the extension. _x000D_
One system is working properly when placing all calls any of the phones. _x000D_
The other system is operating as if each phone is calling as an IP button.
response:
The issue is likely due to the fact that the Grandstream HT813s are not being registered properly with the Bogen E7000 system. This could be due to a variety of reasons such as incorrect SIP server address, incorrect username/password, or incorrect extension settings.

To resolve the issue, I would recommend checking the following:

1. Verify that the SIP server address is correct for each campus.

3. Verify that the extension settings are correct for each Grandstream HT813

subject: Cannot login to controller
query: Controller gives 2 pages of SQLState when you try to login.
response:
The error message "2 pages of SQLState" is usually caused by the controller's SQL database connection being unavailable. This could be due to a variety of reasons such as network issues, SQL server being down, or incorrect SQL credentials.

To fix this issue, I would suggest the following steps:

1. Check the network connectivity between the controller and the SQL server. Ensure that the network is stable and the controller can communicate with the SQL server.
2. Verify the SQL server is up and running. Check the SQL server logs for any errors or issues that might be causing the connection failure.
3. Check the SQL credentials used

subject: Questions On MC200 Upgrade
query: I am quoting upgrading an MC200 to Nyquist. Will call in phones be from the MC200 work on the Nyquist or will they need to be replaced with call in switches?
response:
Hi there! I'd be happy to help you with your query regarding the upgrade from the MC200 to Nyquist.

When upgrading from the MC200 to Nyquist, you will need to replace the call-in phones with call-in switches. The MC200 uses analog phones, which are not compatible with the digital Nyquist system. To ensure seamless integration and optimal performance, it's recommended to replace the analog phones with digital call-in switches.

Here's a step-by-step guide to help you with the process:

1. Disconnect the analog phones from the MC200.
2. Connect the digital call-in switches to the Nyquist

subject: All speakers all call
query:
3rd attempt to rectify. _x000D_
Sometime each day (not same time) any room called from a admin phone will all call all speakers. If a room pushes call button the same thing happens._x000D_
Last week I had two recommendations from T Support. The first was don’t leave any empty spaces between speaker ports. I only had 1 port skipped on 4 ASBs. I corrected the skipped port. The next day it was doing it still. Had a 10 am call with support and was told it was cross talk and I should move all speakers to -2dB. This was done on Friday and same thing is still happening today._x000D_
This system has been in since August of last year. The only change was made 2 weeks ago on 2 of 4 schools that were installed in district on 8/24. The 2 schools with the all call are the only 2 it is happening on. It was not happening previously._x000D_
I am not at site today but will be at site in the morning 3/25. If possible can a call be scheduled. I am available now by phone if additional information is needed
response:
_x000D_

The issue described is a classic case of a "cross-talk" problem in the Bogen E7000 system. The symptoms are consistent with a situation where the system is attempting to broadcast the same audio signal to all speakers, including the admin phones, when a room is called. The fact that this issue started occurring after the recent changes made to the system at the two schools suggests that the problem is related to the changes.

The two recommendations from T-Support were not entirely incorrect, but they did not address the root cause of the problem. The suggestion to remove empty spaces between speaker ports was a

subject: applying admin group  to stations for rollover calls
query: I have a school that is fully configured with seven Analog Bridge devices. The school has now decided they want rollover for all the phones in the main office to occur. I have created the admin group and assigned the three admin phones to the group. The only place I have seen to deploy the admin group is under the settings of each station. I was wanting to know if there is an easier way to accomplish this task? How can I deploy the admin group on a Bridge or server level?
response:
Yes, there is an easier way to deploy the admin group on a Bridge or server level. You can do this by using the "Station Group" feature in the Bogen E7000 system.

Here's how to do it:

1. Go to the Bridge or server where you have created the admin group.
2. Click on "Station Group" under the "Settings" menu.
3. Select the "Admin Group" you have created.
4. Click on the "Deploy" button.
5. The admin group will be deployed to all the stations in your network.

By using the "Station Group" feature,

subject: Reset Admin PW

response:

3. Look for the 'Reset Admin Password' or 'Reset Admin Credentials' option and click on it.

5. Click 'Apply' or 'Save Changes' to save the new admin password.

response:
The issue on the North campus is likely due to a problem with the ASB (Audio Server Bridge) units. The upgrade to firmware 4.4.2 may have caused a compatibility issue with the ASBs, which are not functioning properly.

To resolve the issue, I would recommend the following steps:

1. Check the ASB units for any error messages or logs that may indicate the cause of the problem. This can be done by accessing the ASB units remotely or by checking the system logs.
2. Try to reset the ASB units to their default settings. This may resolve any compatibility issues caused by the

subject: Sound Levels/ Talback and Bogen DDU250 push to talk mic troubleshoot
query: I recently did an upgrade of all firmware and controller software over spring break to resolve an issue i had with the call switches periodically going red and my teachers not being able to call out.  The secretary, oddly enough, could still make "all-calls" and I could get to web interface.  However, the teacher could not page the office.  Also, the conversations were not clear whenever either party made calls, especially if there is any type of chatter in the office, which is everyday at the beginning and end of the day during dropoff and pickup by parents.  Basicly have to tell anyone talking to be quiet, in order to have a 2 way conversation.  The teachers are back this morning so I've been testing of the effectiveness of the updates made.  The sound quality louder.  So far I've found one red button, but I was able to still call the office and it turned blue during the call.  I paged the office from a room, and the moment the principal began talking in the backroom of the office, t
response:
The issue described by the customer is likely due to a firmware or software configuration problem, rather than a hardware issue. The fact that the secretary can still make "all-calls" and the customer can access the web interface suggests that the system's core functionality is intact.

The issue with the teacher's inability to page the office and the poor sound quality during calls is likely due to a misconfiguration of the system's audio settings or a problem with the teacher's extension. It's possible that the upgrade process may have reset some default settings or affected the way the system handles audio signals.

subject: BOGEN NQ-PA120 Paging
query: When you make a page from the NQ-T1100 phone to a PA120 zone a recorded message plays saying that intercom is not available and the zone is page only. Is there any way to stop this message?
response:
Yes, it's possible to stop the recorded message from playing when making a page from the NQ-T1100 phone to a PA120 zone. This message is triggered by the PA120 zone's "Page Only" setting, which is enabled by default. To disable this message, you can follow these steps:

1. Access the PA120 zone's configuration menu using the NQ-T1100 phone.
2. Navigate to the "Zone Settings" section and select the "Page Only" option.
3. Set the "Page Only" option to "Off" or "Disabled".
4. Save the changes and exit

subject: I can't connect my yealink t48U phone to my system controller
query: I just don't know how to get the phone activated into the system and get it fully registered.
response:
Thank you for reaching out! To activate and register your phone within the Bogen E7000 system, follow these steps:

1. Ensure your phone is properly connected to the system via the provided cable or wireless connection.
2. On your phone, navigate to the settings menu and look for the "System" or "Registration" option. This may vary depending on your phone model.
3. Select the option and follow the prompts to enter the required information, such as your phone's MAC address or IP address.
4. Enter the correct registration code provided by your system administrator or the Bogen E7000 system itself.

subject: ntpd stopped trusting county provided time servers
query: I had a school that the time had drifted a while back.  Working with the county IT person, we discovered that the county time server was only using one IP to provide time.  This was corrected and now the system controller will get multiple addresses from the time server.  But my time was still not correcting.  After further research I have noticed that the "*" is set for the local machine. it was probably already preferring local host before they fixed the single time server issue on their end.  Restarting the system controller or changing to a public time server then back, and the * is still preferring local host for time.  I have changed to a public time server for now, but I'd like to get this ironed out. Seems to be across all our 7, 8, and 9 systems for this county. Thanks!
response:
The issue described is related to the time synchronization setting in the Bogen E7000 system. The "*" symbol in the time synchronization setting is used to specify the time source, and in this case, it is set to "Local Machine" which means the system is using the local clock as the time source.

The problem is that the local clock is not being updated correctly, and the system is not getting the correct time from the time server. This is because the county IT person had previously set the time server to only use one IP address, which caused the system to not receive the correct time.

To fix this issue

subject: Phone's not updating time zone/DST correctly every spring.
query: I have systems on 7, 8, and 9.  They all seem to have a problem when we "spring forward".  I go into the phones and set the DST and time zone settings, and i don't hear anything when time changes in the fall.  But every spring I end up going through the phones and changing the DST and time zone settings again.  Is there a recommended setting that will not get overridden by auto provision?  Or maybe I'm doing something wrong here.  Thank you for any help or suggestions for settings.
response:
Thank you for reaching out! I understand your concern about the DST and time zone settings on your Bogen E7000 system. It's frustrating when you have to manually adjust these settings every spring.

2. Verify that the DST settings are enabled on each phone. You can do this by accessing the phone's settings menu, then selecting "Time Zone"
